summary: Anna's Law of 2025 aims to expand trauma-informed training for law enforcement and emergency medical technicians regarding sexual assault, domestic violence, dating violence, and stalking cases. The bill authorizes grants to eligible entities to establish and expand this training, emphasizing the impact of trauma on individuals and offering strategies for trauma-informed responses. The Secretary is mandated to compile a trainer listing and requires specific training hours. Annual reports to Congress will evaluate the program's effectiveness, including an analysis of prosecutions and survivor feedback.
